event.p: This performance was a BBC recording, subsequently broadcast on BBC Radio 3, 21 February 1982.

notesStmt.annot: Delius's one-act opera is a tragedy depicting a single night in Paris, with a libretto by 'Rosenval' (the soubriquet of Berthe Gaston-Danville). It concerns the love triangle between Margot, her lover the Artist, and a soldier, Thibault, who knew Margot when they lived in the same village. Delius's work for soprano, baritone, and orchestra Idyll was based on music from Margot la Rouge, but the opera itself was never performed in Delius's lifetime.

relation.label: Is related to: Prelude and Idyll

notesStmt.annot: This source contains various material including sketches, a complete pencil draft short score, and a copy of the libretto translated into Italian in an unidentified hand.
The original of the last page of the draft short score is in British Library MS Mus. 1745/2/13/3, f. 66.
The autograph score, entitled 'Margot la Rossa' is in French with an added Italian translation, probably in Jelka's hand.

titlePage.p: Margot la Rouge/Drame lyrique en 1 acte/(Piano et chant)/Frederick Delius

annot.p: The publication details given refer to a facsimile edition prepared by Robert Threlfall for the Delius Trust.

notesStmt.annot: This copy of the lithograph was presented to Fenby by Delius and presented to the Delius Trust in 1964. Fenby wrote on the front of the volume: Eric Fenby/Grez-sur-Loing 1932.
This item is inscribed by Delius 'To my friend Philip Heseltine [...] 28/3/1913'. There are a number of corrections, alterations and additions.

annot.p: Inscribed 'To John Coates with kindest greetings from Frederick Delius [...] 15th December 1907. Finished April 1902'. Some alterations, but not the most significant ones made in Heseltine's copy.

repository.corpName: Cadbury Research Library, University of Birmingham

notesStmt.annot: Inscribed by Delius 'To my friend Granville Bantock [...] 1908' and containing most of the alterations appearing in Heseltine's copy.
This copy has no inscription, but contains most of the alterations made to the British Library copy.

annot.p: This score was commissioned from Fenby by the Delius Trust at a time when the autograph score had not been located. The basis for it was the available material he had transferred to Idyll and the vocal score. This version was used for the 1982 BBC broadcast (see RT.1986, 29).
